intro: Gymnadenia odoratissima var. suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented grass of the genus Gymnadenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that emit a sweet, pleasant fragrance. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in temperate regions of Europe. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aromatic properties.
